anime.description: Team TRY3: http://anidb.net/ch70498 [Chrono], http://anidb.net/ch70499 [Shion] and http://anidb.net/ch70497 [Tokoha], managed to win the championship of Generation Quest. In the mean time, however, Ryuzu Myoujin has a secret plan: summoning Zodiac Time Beasts of Gear Chronicle clan to Earth. Chrono and http://anidb.net/ch69679 [Kouji] want to stop Ryuzu, but they are confronted by a mysterious group of cardfighters known as Company who share Ryuzu`s ideology. Source: ANN

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

episode.title: 神崎との再会
Reunion with Kanzaki
Kanzaki to no Saikai
episode.summary: Chrono and Taiyou decide to pay a visit to Yuichirou Kanzaki, former branch chief of United Sanctuary, in order to get info on Ryuzu Myoujin and the Depend Cards. They discover Kanzaki carving giant statues single-mindedly deep in the mountains. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守山ヒロキ
Hiroki Moriyama
Moriyama Hiroki
episode.summary: Company member Hiroki Moriyama shows up at United Sanctuary Branch, but Branch Chief Ren and Tetsu are out. As the representative of the branch, Taiyou challenges Hiroki to a fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明神リューズ
Ryuzu Myoujin
Myoujin Ryuuzu
episode.summary: Six months later. Ryuzu Myoujin is dead, but the Company that he kept carries on his will somewhere... Meanwhile, as Chrono, now a third-year student and Vanguard star, flees from a mob of fans, he encounters an enigmatic boy who talks about fixing the world much like the old, physically ravaged Ryuzu did. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 突入! リューズ・ラボ
Storm Ryuzu`s Lab!
Totsunyuu! Ryuuzu Lab
episode.summary: Team TRY3, Kamui, Ibuki and Kai break into Ryuzu`s facility to safeguard the summoned units, retrieve the Depend Cards and take Ryuzu into custody, but Ryuzu`s "company" keeps them all occupied. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノの記憶
Chrono`s Memories
Chrono no Kioku
episode.summary: Chrono accepts Ryuzu`s invitation and is taken to an abandoned factory, where they begin a furious fight. In the midst of it, images of long-forgotten memories run through Chrono`s mind. Memories of Ryuzu and his father, Rive, as younger men, and himself as a small child... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不機嫌な見舞客
An Ill-Tempered Visitor
Fukigen na Mimai Kyaku
episode.summary: A unit has materialized at last! But a lot of people suffered serious injuries from its attack, including Mamoru, who was hospitalized. The disaster happened right before Tokoha`s eyes, leaving her with emotional scars and in a state of deep depression. But then a surprising visitor shows up at the hospital! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドラゴンエンパイア支部崩壊
Collapse of the Dragon Empire Branch
Dragon Empire Shibu Houkai
episode.summary: At the Dragon Empire Branch, Mamoru leads a meeting of the assembled temporary branch chiefs regarding Ryuzu`s conspiracy. Suddenly, Enishi, the missing Dark Zone Branch Chief, appears among them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タイヨウVSヒロキ
Taiyou Versus Hiroki
Taiyou VS Hiroki
episode.summary: In order to prevent Hiroki Moriyama from recapturing Ryuzu`s former lab, which is still being investigated by Ibuki and the others, Taiyou has a rematch with the insufferable Company agent. Through the fight, Taiyou closes in on the secret within Hiroki`s heart, the reason he obstinately clings to the self-styled title of "champion of justice." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 三人で, 再び
The Trio, Once More
Sannin de, Futatabi
episode.summary: When TRY3 and Taiyou are in the middle of a strategy meeting at Shion`s apartment, Jaime shows up and takes them all to a South Seas island. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歌姫の三重奏[トライアングル]
Triangle of Divas
Utahime no Triangle
episode.summary: Saya has become one of the world`s most famous Vanguard idols. Now she`s brought two powerful assistants from abroad to help her throw the Happy Vanguard Festival at Dragon Empire Branch. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ディペンドカード覚醒
Awakening of the Depend Card
Depend Card Kakusei
episode.summary: As Shion, Ibuki and the others track down Chrono, who disappeared with Ryuzu, they clash with the hindering head honchos of the Company. Meanwhile, in the aftermath of Chrono and Ryuzu`s fierce fight, the powered-up Depend Cards are unleashed! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 東雲の愉悦
Shinonome`s Joy
Shinonome no Yuetsu
episode.summary: Just as scientific genius Sousuke Wakamizu has prepared everything to open the Stride Gate, Shinonome appears with his usual mischievous smirk and a desire to mix things up. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 江西VSアム
Enishi Versus Am
Enishi VS Am
episode.summary: Luna has "nobly sacrificed" herself for the sake of a "perfect future." Or at least that`s what Enishi claims when Am tries to get the comatose Luna back. What will the verdict be when Am and Enishi fight over their claim? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激闘! トリニティドラゴン
Trinity Dragon`s Fierce Battle
Gekitou! Trinity Dragon
episode.summary: Trinity Dragon infiltrates an experimental facility run by Company man Sousuke Wakamizu?! The three work together to expose the Company`s evil deeds! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束
Promise
Yakusoku
episode.summary: Ibuki and Chris continue to put up a desperate resistance against Ryuzu`s steadily advancing machinations. Amid all of that, Chrono challenges Ibuki to a fight. The two of them finally talk about their feelings for each other and make a decision about what to do going forward. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ライブとリューズ
Rive and Ryuzu
Rive to Ryuuzu
episode.summary: Once, Team Nippon was a well-known national Vanguard Fight champion. Now a former member, Shin, shares his memories of the old days with Chrono. And so Chrono learns the truth about how Rive and Ryuzu first met. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光輝の剣
Blazing Sword
Kouki no Ken
episode.summary: The time to settle all fates has come! Shinonome has taken everything from Shion and now even brags that the destiny he`s envisioned for Shion is coming to pass. Can Shion do anything to put a damper on Shinonome`s warped sense of joy? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 機械仕掛けの神
Deus Ex Machina
Kikaijikake no Kami
episode.summary: Thanks to Shinonome`s meddling with the system, Ibuki has become immune to the "siren song" of Ryuzu`s imaginary world. Ibuki confronts Ryuzu alone and challenges him to a fight with everything at stake! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 審判の刻[とき]
Time of Judgment
Shinpan no Toki
episode.summary: Moment by moment, Ryuzu`s imagination is blanketing Earth. Inside of the "Tower of Light" that connects the Stride Gate to Earth, chimes ring out as if announcing the beginning of the trial that summons Chrono and the others. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 完全なる未来
Perfect Future
Kanzen Naru Mirai
episode.summary: The "perfect future" that Ryuzu yearns for is at hand. In the critical moment, Chrono, Tokoha and Shion face the "final judgment" in order to prevent that future. The battle begins, with the future of Cray and Earth hanging in the balance. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: NEXT STAGE
Next Stage
Next Stage
episode.summary: The battle is over. Now everyone is moving on to their own "next stage"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イメージを超えた未来
Future Beyond Imagination
Image o Koeta Mirai
episode.summary: Chrono channels all of his strength to destroy Ryuzu`s "perfect future" for the sake of the future he`ll grasp himself. What will be the outcome of their fierce fight?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クロノVSリューズ
Chrono Versus Ryuzu
Chrono VS Ryuuzu
episode.summary: A "promise" was carried out. Now, bearing Ibuki`s feelings, Chrono runs to the place where Ryuzu is waiting. The fight that will determine the fate of two worlds, Cray and Earth, begins here! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本当の気持ち
True Feelings
Hontou no Kimochi
episode.summary: Inside the tower of light, Satoru Enishi appears before Tokoha. Meanwhile, Am is prevented from waking the comatose Luna by a materialized thought form of Luna that is determined to "save" Am, whether she wants it or not! Source: crunchyroll
